form.longName: PhenX PX640202 - Intensity Of Suicidal Ideation Continuum Adult
form.preferredDefinition: The Scale for Suicide Ideation (SSI) is a 21-item, interviewer-administered scale that measures the current intensity of patients' specific attitudes, behaviors, and plans to commit suicide on the day of the interview and during the time period that they were most suicidal. The first 5 items are screeners (wish to live, wish to die, and desire to attempt suicide), followed by 14 items to assess suicidal risk factors. The last 2 items capture previous suicide attempts. The respondent is first asked all questions about their suicidal ideation on the day of the interview and then queried about the most severe point of suicidal ideation. Each item is rated on a 3-point scale ranging from 0 to 2 according to suicidal intensity. The SSI is scored by adding up the ratings (0-2) from the first 19 items.

question.questionText: Today's Date: (date_640202)
Times of Crisis Approximate Date at the Most Severe Point (crisis_date_640202)
Section I Characteristics of Attitude Toward Living/Dying: (living_dying_640202)
1. Wish to Live (wish_to_live_current)
2. Wish to Die (wish_to_die_current)
3. Reasons for Living/Dying (reasons_for_livingdying_current)
4. Desire to Make Active Suicide Attempt (desire_active_suicide_attempt_current)
5. Passive Suicidal Attempt (passive_suicidal_attempt_current)

validValue.meaningText: Would take precautions to save life =0
validValue.description: Would take precautions to save life =0

validValue.meaningText: Would leave life/death to chance (e.g., carelessly crossing a busy street) =1
validValue.description: Would leave life/death to chance (e.g., carelessly crossing a busy street) =1

validValue.meaningText: Would avoid steps necessary to save or maintain life (e.g., diabetic ceasing to take insulin) =2
validValue.description: Would avoid steps necessary to save or maintain life (e.g., diabetic ceasing to take insulin) =2

question.questionText: If all four code entries for Items 4 and 5 are "0," skip Sections II, III, and IV. (skip_640202)
Section II. Characteristics of Suicide Ideation/Wish (section_ii_640202)
6. Time Dimension: Duration (time_dimension_duration_current)
7. Time Dimension: Frequency (time_dimension_frequency_current)
8. Attitude Toward Ideation/Wish (attitude_toward_ideation_current)
9. Control Over Suicidal Action/Acting Out Wish (control_over_suicidal_action_current)

10. Deterrents to Active Attempt (e.g., family, religion possibility of serious injury if unsuccessful irreversibility) Please describe any deterrents below. (deterrents_active_suicideattempt_current)

validValue.meaningText: Would not attempt suicide because of a deterrent=0
validValue.description: Would not attempt suicide because of a deterrent=0

validValue.meaningText: Minimal or no concern about deterrents=2
validValue.description: Minimal or no concern about deterrents=2

question.questionText: Deterrents to Active Attempt (e.g., family, religion possibility of serious injury if unsuccessful irreversibility) Indicate deterrents, if any: (deterrents_active_suicideattempt_indicate_current)
11. Reason for Contemplated Attempt (reasons_contemplated_suicide_attempt_current)

validValue.meaningText: To manipulate the environment; get attention revenge =0
validValue.description: To manipulate the environment; get attention revenge =0

question.questionText: Section III Characteristics of Contemplated Attempt (section_iii_640202)
12. Method: Specificity/Planning (suicide_method_specificity_planning_current)

validValue.meaningText: Considered, but details not worked out =1
validValue.description: Considered, but details not worked out =1

question.questionText: 13. Method: Availability/Opportunity (suicide_method_availability_opportunity_current)

validValue.meaningText: Method would take time/effort; opportunity not readily available =1
validValue.description: Method would take time/effort; opportunity not readily available =1

validValue.meaningText: Future opportunity or availability of method anticipated =2b
validValue.description: Future opportunity or availability of method anticipated =2b

question.questionText: 14. Sense of "Capability" to Carry Out Attempt (sense_of_suicide_capability_current)

validValue.meaningText: No courage, too weak, afraid, incompetent =0
validValue.description: No courage, too weak, afraid, incompetent =0

question.questionText: 15. Expectancy/Anticipation of Actual Attempt (expectancy_anticipation_suicide_attempt_current)
Section IV. Actualization of Contemplated Attempt (section_iv_640202)
16. Actual Preparation (actual_suicide_preparation_current)

validValue.meaningText: Complete (e.g., had pills, razor, loaded gun) =2
validValue.description: Complete (e.g., had pills, razor, loaded gun) =2

question.questionText: 17. Suicide Note (suicide_note_current)

validValue.meaningText: Started but not completed; only thought about =1
validValue.description: Started but not completed; only thought about =1

question.questionText: 18. Final Acts in Anticipation of Death (e.g., insurance, will, gifts) (suicide_final_acts)

validValue.meaningText: Thought about or made some arrangements =1
validValue.description: Thought about or made some arrangements =1

validValue.meaningText: Made definite plans or completed arrangements =2
validValue.description: Made definite plans or completed arrangements =2

question.questionText: 19. Deception/Concealment of Contemplated Attempt (suicide_deception_contemplated_attempt_current)
20. Previous Suicide Attempts (previous_suicide_events)
21. Intent to Die Associated with Last Attempt (intent_die_lastsuicideattempt_current)
Scoring: Each item is rated on a 3point scale ranging from 0 to 2 according to suicidal intensity. The SSI is scored by adding up the ratings (02) from the first 19 items. (scoring_640202)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Scale for Suicide Ideation (SSI) is a 21-item, interviewer-administered scale that measures the current intensity of patients' specific attitudes, behaviors, and plans to commit suicide on the day of the interview and during the time period that they were most suicidal. The first 5 items are screeners (wish to live, wish to die, and desire to attempt suicide), followed by 14 items to assess suicidal risk factors. The last 2 items capture previous suicide attempts. The respondent is first asked all questions about their suicidal ideation on the day of the interview and then queried about the most severe point of suicidal ideation. Each item is rated on a 3-point scale ranging from 0 to 2 according to suicidal intensity. The SSI is scored by adding up the ratings (0-2) from the first 19 items.

form.longName: PhenX PX640301 - Suicidal Intent Of Suicide Attempts
form.preferredDefinition: The Suicide Intent Scale (SIS) includes 15 interviewer-administered items that measure behavior before and during the most recent suicide attempt. Items 1-8 cover objective circumstances surrounding the attempt (e.g., preparation and execution of the attempt). Items 9-15 capture perceptions of potential lethality, expectations of rescue, purpose of the attempt, impulsivity, and reaction to the attempt. Each of the 15 items is scored from 0 to 2 and added together to give a total score from 0 to 30. A self-report version of the Suicide Intent Scale is also available.

headerInstruction.text: SUICIDE INTENT SCALE (For Attempters) Instructions: Interview the patient about his/her most recent suicide attempt to enable a reliable coding of the objective circumstances of the attempt, and the patient's perceptions of the attempt.

question.questionText: I. Objective Circumstances Related to Suicide Attempt (section_1_640301)
1. Isolation (suicide_attempt_circumstances_isolation)

validValue.meaningText: Somebody nearby, or in visual or vocal contact =1
validValue.description: Somebody nearby, or in visual or vocal contact =1

validValue.meaningText: No one nearby or in visual or vocal contact =2
validValue.description: No one nearby or in visual or vocal contact =2

question.questionText: 2. Timing (suicide_attempt_circumstances_timing)
3. Precautions against Discovery/Intervention (suicide_attempt_circumstances_precautions)

validValue.meaningText: Passive precautions (avoiding others but doing nothing to prevent intervention; alone in room with unlocked door) =1
validValue.description: Passive precautions (avoiding others but doing nothing to prevent intervention; alone in room with unlocked door) =1

question.questionText: 4. Acting to Get Help During/After Attempt (suicide_attempt_circumstances_gettinghelp)

validValue.meaningText: Contacted but did not specifically notify potential helper regarding attempt =1
validValue.description: Contacted but did not specifically notify potential helper regarding attempt =1

validValue.meaningText: Did not contact or notify potential helper =2
validValue.description: Did not contact or notify potential helper =2

question.questionText: 5. Final Acts in Anticipation of Death (e.g., will, gifts, insurance) (suicide_attempt_circumstances_finalacts)

validValue.meaningText: Thought about or made some arrangements =1
validValue.description: Thought about or made some arrangements =1

validValue.meaningText: Made definite plans or completed arrangements =2
validValue.description: Made definite plans or completed arrangements =2

question.questionText: 6. Preparation for Attempt (suicide_attempt_circumstances_activepreparation)
7. Suicide Note (suicide_attempt_circumstances_note)

validValue.meaningText: Note written, but torn up; note thought about =1
validValue.description: Note written, but torn up; note thought about =1

question.questionText: 8. Overt Communication of Intent Before the Attempt (suicide_attempt_circumstances_communication)
II. SelfReport (section_2_640301)
9. Alleged Purpose of Attempt (suicide_attempt_purpose)

validValue.meaningText: To manipulate environment, get attention, revenge =0
validValue.description: To manipulate environment, get attention, revenge =0

question.questionText: 10. Expectations of Fatality (suicide_attempt_expectation_fatality)

validValue.meaningText: Thought that death was possible but not probable =1
validValue.description: Thought that death was possible but not probable =1

validValue.meaningText: Thought that death was probable or certain =2
validValue.description: Thought that death was probable or certain =2

question.questionText: 11. Conception of Method's Lethality (suicide_attempt_conception_method_fatality)

validValue.meaningText: Did less to self than he thought would be lethal =0
validValue.description: Did less to self than he thought would be lethal =0

validValue.meaningText: Wasn't sure if what he did would be lethal =1
validValue.description: Wasn't sure if what he did would be lethal =1

validValue.meaningText: Equaled or exceeded what he thought would be lethal =2
validValue.description: Equaled or exceeded what he thought would be lethal =2

question.questionText: 12. Seriousness of Attempt (suicide_attempt_seriousness)

validValue.meaningText: Did not seriously attempt to end life =0
validValue.description: Did not seriously attempt to end life =0

validValue.meaningText: Uncertain about seriousness to end life =1
validValue.description: Uncertain about seriousness to end life =1

question.questionText: 13. Attitude Toward Living/Dying (suicide_attempt_attitude_toward_livingdying)
14. Conception of Medical Rescuability (suicide_attempt_conception_rescuability)

validValue.meaningText: Thought that death would be unlikely if he received medical attention =0
validValue.description: Thought that death would be unlikely if he received medical attention =0

validValue.meaningText: Was uncertain whether death could be averted by medical attention =1
validValue.description: Was uncertain whether death could be averted by medical attention =1

validValue.meaningText: Was certain of death even if he received medical attention =2
validValue.description: Was certain of death even if he received medical attention =2

question.questionText: 15. Degree of Premeditation (suicide_attempt_premeditation)

validValue.meaningText: Suicide contemplated for three hours or less prior to attempt =1
validValue.description: Suicide contemplated for three hours or less prior to attempt =1

validValue.meaningText: Suicide contemplated for more than three hours prior to attempt =2
validValue.description: Suicide contemplated for more than three hours prior to attempt =2

question.questionText: III. Other Aspects (Not Included in Total Score) (section_3_640301)
16. Reaction to Attempt (suicide_attempt_reaction)

validValue.meaningText: Sorry about attempt; feels foolish, ashamed (circle which one) =0
validValue.description: Sorry about attempt; feels foolish, ashamed (circle which one) =0

validValue.meaningText: Accepts both attempt and its failure =1
validValue.description: Accepts both attempt and its failure =1

question.questionText: 17. Visualization of Death (suicide_attempt_visualization_death)

validValue.meaningText: No conceptions of, or thoughts about death =2
validValue.description: No conceptions of, or thoughts about death =2

question.questionText: 18. Number of Previous Attempts (suicide_attempt_number)
19. Relationship between Alcohol Intake and Attempt (suicide_attempt_alcohol_relationship)

validValue.meaningText: Some alcohol intake prior to but not related to attempt, reportedly not enough to impair judgment, reality testing =0
validValue.description: Some alcohol intake prior to but not related to attempt, reportedly not enough to impair judgment, reality testing =0

validValue.meaningText: Enough alcohol intake to impair judgment, reality testing and diminish responsibility/impulse control =1
validValue.description: Enough alcohol intake to impair judgment, reality testing and diminish responsibility/impulse control =1

validValue.meaningText: Intentional intake of alcohol in order to facilitate implementation of suicide attempt =2
validValue.description: Intentional intake of alcohol in order to facilitate implementation of suicide attempt =2

question.questionText: 20. Relationship between Drug Intake and Attempt (narcotics, hallucinogens, etc. drug is not the method used to suicide) (suicide_attempt_drugs_relationship)

validValue.meaningText: Some drug intake prior to but not related to attempt, reportedly not enough to impair judgment, reality testing =0
validValue.description: Some drug intake prior to but not related to attempt, reportedly not enough to impair judgment, reality testing =0

validValue.meaningText: Enough drug intake to impair judgment, identity testing and diminish responsibility/impulse control =1
validValue.description: Enough drug intake to impair judgment, identity testing and diminish responsibility/impulse control =1

validValue.meaningText: Intentional drug intake in order to facilitate implementation of suicide attempt =2
validValue.description: Intentional drug intake in order to facilitate implementation of suicide attempt =2

question.questionText: Scoring: Each of the 15 items is scored from 0 to 2 and added together to give a total score from 0 to 30. (scoring_640301)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Suicide Intent Scale (SIS) includes 15 interviewer-administered items that measure behavior before and during the most recent suicide attempt. Items 1-8 cover objective circumstances surrounding the attempt (e.g., preparation and execution of the attempt). Items 9-15 capture perceptions of potential lethality, expectations of rescue, purpose of the attempt, impulsivity, and reaction to the attempt. Each of the 15 items is scored from 0 to 2 and added together to give a total score from 0 to 30. A self-report version of the Suicide Intent Scale is also available.

form.longName: PhenX PX640401 - Lethality Of Suicide Attempts
form.preferredDefinition: The Beck Lethality Scales includes eight items that measure the medical lethality of previous suicide attempts (e.g., shooting, jumping, and drug overdose). Each scale is rated from 0 to 10, based on an examination of the patient's physical condition on admission, review of the medical charts, and consultation with the attending physician.

headerInstruction.text: BECK LETHALITY SCALES Instructions to interviewer: These scales establish the lethality of patients' suicide attempt(s). Use all available information to establish the lethality of each previous suicide attempt. Enter the date (MM/YY) of eac..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Month of suicide attempt 1 (most recent) (suicide_attempt1_month)
Year of suicide attempt 1 (most recent) (suicide_attempt1_year)
LETH 01 Lethality Scale for ComaProducing Drugs Suicide attempt 1, first suicide lethality code (Most Lethal) LETH 01 (suicide_attempt1_primary_lethality_code)

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Lethargic-speech and motility retarded but responsive to questions; intellectual functions intact
validValue.description: 02 - Lethargic-speech and motility retarded but responsive to questions; intellectual functions intact

validValue.meaningText: 03 - Lethargic with diminution in intellectual ability
validValue.description: 03 - Lethargic with diminution in intellectual ability

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Severely blunted, dull, or lacking in vigor, but awake and somewhat responsive
validValue.description: 04 - Severely blunted, dull, or lacking in vigor, but awake and somewhat responsive

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Comatose-withdrawal from painful stimuli; reflexes intact
validValue.description: 06 - Comatose-withdrawal from painful stimuli; reflexes intact

validValue.meaningText: 07 - Comatose-no withdrawal from painful stimuli; most reflexes intact; no respiratory or circulatory depression
validValue.description: 07 - Comatose-no withdrawal from painful stimuli; most reflexes intact; no respiratory or circulatory depression

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Comatose-most reflexes absent; no respiratory or circulatory depression
validValue.description: 08 - Comatose-most reflexes absent; no respiratory or circulatory depression

validValue.meaningText: 09 - Comatose-all reflexes absent; respiratory depression with cyanosis or circulatory failure and shock both
validValue.description: 09 - Comatose-all reflexes absent; respiratory depression with cyanosis or circulatory failure and shock both

question.questionText: LETH 02 Lethality for NonComaProducing Drugs Suicide attempt 1, second suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_secondary_lethality_code)

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Some injury (e.g. mouth burns) and treatment in emergency room or on out-patient basis (e.g. gastric lavage)
validValue.description: 04 - Some injury (e.g. mouth burns) and treatment in emergency room or on out-patient basis (e.g. gastric lavage)

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Injury sufficient for hospitalization-vital signs and level of consciousness may be affected
validValue.description: 06 - Injury sufficient for hospitalization-vital signs and level of consciousness may be affected

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Major systemic effects-such as G.I. perforation, renal failure, blood hemolysis, or shock; vital signs unstable
validValue.description: 08 - Major systemic effects-such as G.I. perforation, renal failure, blood hemolysis, or shock; vital signs unstable

question.questionText: LETH 03 Lethality Scale for Shooting Suicide attempt 1, third suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_tertiary_lethality_code)

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Bullet in abdomen or chest-major bleeding; vital signs unstable
validValue.description: 06 - Bullet in abdomen or chest-major bleeding; vital signs unstable

question.questionText: LETH 04 Lethality Scale for Burning Suicide attempt 1, fourth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_tert4)

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Third degree burns over 20% of body
validValue.description: 06 - Third degree burns over 20% of body

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Third degree burns over 80% of body
validValue.description: 08 - Third degree burns over 80% of body

question.questionText: ETH 05 Lethality Scale for Drowning Suicide attempt 1, fifth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_tert5)

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Conscious-some respiratory distress but no resuscitation needed
validValue.description: 02 - Conscious-some respiratory distress but no resuscitation needed

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Conscious-minimal to moderate efforts at resuscitation needed
validValue.description: 04 - Conscious-minimal to moderate efforts at resuscitation needed

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Unconscious-massive efforts at resuscitation necessary for revival
validValue.description: 08 - Unconscious-massive efforts at resuscitation necessary for revival

question.questionText: LETH 06 Lethality Scale for Cutting Suicide attempt 1, sixth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_tert6)

validValue.meaningText: 00 - Surface scratches; none or minor bleeding; little or no wound care required.
validValue.description: 00 - Surface scratches; none or minor bleeding; little or no wound care required.

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Moderate bleeding with clotting before significant blood loss occurs; simple wound care required
validValue.description: 02 - Moderate bleeding with clotting before significant blood loss occurs; simple wound care required

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Bleeding of major vessel; danger of considerable blood loss without surgical intervention-suturing necessary but no transfusion; vital areas intact and no change in vital signs; care on out-patient basis
validValue.description: 04 - Bleeding of major vessel; danger of considerable blood loss without surgical intervention-suturing necessary but no transfusion; vital areas intact and no change in vital signs; care on out-patient basis

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Extensive blood loss; suturing, blood replacement and tendon repair required; wound may be to head, thorax, or abdomen but vital organs intact and vital signs stable; recovery with in-patient care expected
validValue.description: 06 - Extensive blood loss; suturing, blood replacement and tendon repair required; wound may be to head, thorax, or abdomen but vital organs intact and vital signs stable; recovery with in-patient care expected

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Extensive blood loss with shock; insult to vital areas with change in vital signs; recovery with in-patient care doubtful
validValue.description: 08 - Extensive blood loss with shock; insult to vital areas with change in vital signs; recovery with in-patient care doubtful

question.questionText: LETH 07 Lethality Scale for Jumping Suicide attempt 1, seventh suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_tert7)

validValue.meaningText: 00 - Minor bruises only no treatment necessary
validValue.description: 00 - Minor bruises only no treatment necessary

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Sprains or minor injuries-no bone, ligament, or tendon damage; no internal bleeding, tissue or brain damage
validValue.description: 02 - Sprains or minor injuries-no bone, ligament, or tendon damage; no internal bleeding, tissue or brain damage

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Extremities fractured-casting necessary but no major tendon repair and complete recovery expected
validValue.description: 04 - Extremities fractured-casting necessary but no major tendon repair and complete recovery expected

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Major one and/or tendon damage in multiple areas-internal bleeding; some residual impairment expected but not in vital areas
validValue.description: 06 - Major one and/or tendon damage in multiple areas-internal bleeding; some residual impairment expected but not in vital areas

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Major damage to vital area (skull, neck, spinal column); paralysis expected
validValue.description: 08 - Major damage to vital area (skull, neck, spinal column); paralysis expected

question.questionText: LETH 08 Lethality Scale for Hanging Suicide attempt 1, eighth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt1_tert8)

validValue.meaningText: 04 - More extensive injuries with treatment on out-patient basis
validValue.description: 04 - More extensive injuries with treatment on out-patient basis

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Paralysis or other spinal cord injury
validValue.description: 08 - Paralysis or other spinal cord injury

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Comatose-withdrawal from painful stimuli; reflexes intact
validValue.description: 06 - Comatose-withdrawal from painful stimuli; reflexes intact

validValue.meaningText: 07 - Comatose-no withdrawal from painful stimuli; most reflexes intact; no respiratory or circulatory depression
validValue.description: 07 - Comatose-no withdrawal from painful stimuli; most reflexes intact; no respiratory or circulatory depression

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Comatose-most reflexes absent; no respiratory or circulatory depression
validValue.description: 08 - Comatose-most reflexes absent; no respiratory or circulatory depression

validValue.meaningText: 09 - Comatose-all reflexes absent; respiratory depression with cyanosis or circulatory failure and shock both
validValue.description: 09 - Comatose-all reflexes absent; respiratory depression with cyanosis or circulatory failure and shock both

question.questionText: LETH 02 Lethality Scale NonComaProducing Drugs Suicide attempt 3, second suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_secondary_lethality_code)

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Some injury (e.g. mouth burns) and treatment in emergency room or on out-patient basis (e.g. gastric lavage)
validValue.description: 04 - Some injury (e.g. mouth burns) and treatment in emergency room or on out-patient basis (e.g. gastric lavage)

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Injury sufficient for hospitalization-vital signs and level of consciousness may be affected
validValue.description: 06 - Injury sufficient for hospitalization-vital signs and level of consciousness may be affected

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Major systemic effects-such as G.I. perforation, renal failure, blood hemolysis, or shock; vital signs unstable
validValue.description: 08 - Major systemic effects-such as G.I. perforation, renal failure, blood hemolysis, or shock; vital signs unstable

question.questionText: LETH 03 Lethality Scale for Shooting Suicide attempt 3, third suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_tertiary_lethality_code)

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Bullet in abdomen or chest-major bleeding; vital signs unstable
validValue.description: 06 - Bullet in abdomen or chest-major bleeding; vital signs unstable

question.questionText: Leth 04 Lethality Scale for Burning Suicide attempt 3, fourth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_tert4)

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Third degree burns over 20% of body
validValue.description: 06 - Third degree burns over 20% of body

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Third degree burns over 80% of body
validValue.description: 08 - Third degree burns over 80% of body

question.questionText: Leth 05 Lethality Scale for Drowning Suicide attempt 3, fifth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_tert5)

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Conscious-some respiratory distress but no resuscitation needed
validValue.description: 02 - Conscious-some respiratory distress but no resuscitation needed

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Conscious-minimal to moderate efforts at resuscitation needed
validValue.description: 04 - Conscious-minimal to moderate efforts at resuscitation needed

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Unconscious-massive efforts at resuscitation necessary for revival
validValue.description: 08 - Unconscious-massive efforts at resuscitation necessary for revival

question.questionText: Leth 06 Lethality Scale for Cutting Suicide attempt 3, sixth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_tert6)

validValue.meaningText: 00 - Surface scratches; none or minor bleeding; little or no wound care required.
validValue.description: 00 - Surface scratches; none or minor bleeding; little or no wound care required.

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Moderate bleeding with clotting before significant blood loss occurs; simple wound care required
validValue.description: 02 - Moderate bleeding with clotting before significant blood loss occurs; simple wound care required

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Bleeding of major vessel; danger of considerable blood loss without surgical intervention-suturing necessary but no transfusion; vital areas intact and no change in vital signs; care on out-patient basis
validValue.description: 04 - Bleeding of major vessel; danger of considerable blood loss without surgical intervention-suturing necessary but no transfusion; vital areas intact and no change in vital signs; care on out-patient basis

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Extensive blood loss; suturing, blood replacement and tendon repair required; wound may be to head, thorax, or abdomen but vital organs intact and vital signs stable; recovery with in-patient care expected
validValue.description: 06 - Extensive blood loss; suturing, blood replacement and tendon repair required; wound may be to head, thorax, or abdomen but vital organs intact and vital signs stable; recovery with in-patient care expected

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Extensive blood loss with shock; insult to vital areas with change in vital signs; recovery with in-patient care doubtful
validValue.description: 08 - Extensive blood loss with shock; insult to vital areas with change in vital signs; recovery with in-patient care doubtful

question.questionText: Leth 07 Lethality Scale for Jumping Suicide attempt 3, seventh suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_tert7)

validValue.meaningText: 00 - Minor bruises only no treatment necessary
validValue.description: 00 - Minor bruises only no treatment necessary

validValue.meaningText: 02 - Sprains or minor injuries-no bone, ligament, or tendon damage; no internal bleeding, tissue or brain damage
validValue.description: 02 - Sprains or minor injuries-no bone, ligament, or tendon damage; no internal bleeding, tissue or brain damage

validValue.meaningText: 04 - Extremities fractured-casting necessary but no major tendon repair and complete recovery expected
validValue.description: 04 - Extremities fractured-casting necessary but no major tendon repair and complete recovery expected

validValue.meaningText: 06 - Major one and/or tendon damage in multiple areas-internal bleeding; some residual impairment expected but not in vital areas
validValue.description: 06 - Major one and/or tendon damage in multiple areas-internal bleeding; some residual impairment expected but not in vital areas

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Major damage to vital area (skull, neck, spinal column); paralysis expected
validValue.description: 08 - Major damage to vital area (skull, neck, spinal column); paralysis expected

question.questionText: Leth 08 Lethality Scale for Hanging Suicide attempt 3, eighth suicide lethality code (suicide_attempt3_tert8)

validValue.meaningText: 04 - More extensive injuries with treatment on out-patient basis
validValue.description: 04 - More extensive injuries with treatment on out-patient basis

validValue.meaningText: 08 - Paralysis or other spinal cord injury
validValue.description: 08 - Paralysis or other spinal cord injury

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Beck Lethality Scales includes eight items that measure the medical lethality of previous suicide attempts (e.g., shooting, jumping, and drug overdose). Each scale is rated from 0 to 10, based on an examination of the patient's physical condition on admission, review of the medical charts, and consultation with the attending physician.

form.longName: PhenX PX640104 - Classif Of Suicidal Ideation And Beh Adolescentepide
form.preferredDefinition: The Suicidality module of the World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview includes 14 interviewer-administered questions that address adolescent suicidal ideation, plans, attempts, intent, lethality, and method. The protocol includes parallel questions for those who can and cannot read.

module.longName: Classification of Suicidal Ideation and Suicidal Behavior - Adolescent - Epidemiology
module.preferredDefinition: Classification of Suicidal Ideation and Suicidal Behavior - Adolescent - Epidemiology

question.questionText: 1. INTERVIEWER CHECKPOINT: (interviewer_checkpoint_can_respondent_read)

2. Three experiences are listed in your booklet on page 20 labeled A, B, and C. Did Experience A ever happen to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE A IS YOU SERIOUSLY THOUGHT ABOUT KILLING YOURSELF (thoughtabout_killingyourself_abletoread)

validValue.meaningText: DON'T KNOW - go to next section
validValue.description: DON'T KNOW - go to next section

question.questionText: 2a. How old were you the first time this happened? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE A IS YOU SERIOUSLY THOUGHT ABOUT KILLING YOURSELF (thoughtabout_killingyourself_firsttimeage_abletoread)
2a. How old were you the first time this happened? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE A IS YOU SERIOUSLY THOUGHT ABOUT KILLING YOURSELF (thoughtabout_killingyourself_firsttimeagecoded_abletoread)

validValue.meaningText: DON'T KNOW - go to next section
validValue.description: DON'T KNOW - go to next section

question.questionText: 3a. How old were you the last time this experience happened to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE A IS YOU SERIOUSLY THOUGHT ABOUT KILLING YOURSELF (thoughtabout_killingyourself_lasttimeage_abletoread)

3a. How old were you the last time this experience happened to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE A IS YOU SERIOUSLY THOUGHT ABOUT KILLING YOURSELF (thoughtabout_killingyourself_lasttimeagecoded_abletoread)

4. Now look at the second of the three experiences on the list, Experience B. Did Experience B ever happen to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE B IS YOU MADE A PLAN FOR KILLING YOURSELF (planto_killyourself_abletoread)
4a. How old were you the first time this happened? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE B IS YOU MADE A PLAN FOR KILLING YOURSELF (planto_killyourself_firsttimeage_abletoread)
4a. How old were you the first time this happened? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE B IS YOU MADE A PLAN FOR KILLING YOURSELF (planto_killyourself_firsttimeagecoded_abletoread)
5. Did Experience B happen to you at any time in the past 12 months? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE B IS YOU MADE A PLAN FOR KILLING YOURSELF (planto_killyourself_pastyear_abletoread)
5a. How old were you the last time this experience happened to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE B IS YOU MADE A PLAN FOR KILLING YOURSELF (planto_killyourself_lasttimeage_abletoread)
5a. How old were you the last time this experience happened to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE B IS YOU MADE A PLAN FOR KILLING YOURSELF (planto_killyourself_lasttimeagecoded_abletoread)

6. Now look at the third of the three experiences on the list, Experience C. Did experience C ever happen to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE C IS YOU TRIED TO KILL YOURSELF (triedto_killyourself_abletoread)

validValue.meaningText: DON'T KNOW - go to next section
validValue.description: DON'T KNOW - go to next section

question.questionText: 6a. How many times did Experience C ever happen to you in your lifetime? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE C IS YOU TRIED TO KILL YOURSELF (triedto_killyourself_lifetimenumber_abletoread)
6a. How many times did Experience C ever happen to you in your lifetime? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE C IS YOU TRIED TO KILL YOURSELF (triedto_killyourself_lifetimenumbercoded_abletoread)

6.1. INTERVIEWER INSTRUCTION: CIRCLE LETTER "K" IN LONG/SHORT GROUP ON REFERENCE CARD (SIDE TWO). THEN GO TO 7.7. INTERVIEWER CHECKPOINT: (SEE 6a) 6a CODED "1" ................................................. 1 GO TO 10ALL OTHERS (info_640104)
8. How old were you the first time? (triedto_killyourself_firstage_abletoread)
8a. How old were you the first time? (triedto_killyourself_firstagecoded_abletoread)

9. There are three statements numbered 1, 2, and 3 on page 21 in your booklet. Which of these three statements best describes your situation when Experience C happened to you the first time 1, 2, or 3? (triedto_killyourself_situationfirsttime_abletoread)

validValue.meaningText: I MADE A SERIOUS ATTEMPT TO KILL MYSELF AND IT WAS ONLY LUCK THAT I DID NOT SUCCEED
validValue.description: I MADE A SERIOUS ATTEMPT TO KILL MYSELF AND IT WAS ONLY LUCK THAT I DID NOT SUCCEED

validValue.meaningText: I TRIED TO KILL MYSELF, BUT KNEW THAT THE METHOD MAY NOT WORK
validValue.description: I TRIED TO KILL MYSELF, BUT KNEW THAT THE METHOD MAY NOT WORK

validValue.meaningText: MY ATTEMPT WAS A CRY FOR HELP. I DID NOT INTEND TO DIE
validValue.description: MY ATTEMPT WAS A CRY FOR HELP. I DID NOT INTEND TO DIE

10a. How old were you (when/the last time) Experience C happened to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE C IS YOU TRIED TO KILL YOURSELF (go to #14) (triedto_killyourself_lasttimeage_abletoread)
10a. How old were you (when/the last time) Experience C happened to you? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE C IS YOU TRIED TO KILL YOURSELF (triedto_killyourself_lasttimeagecoded_abletoread)
11. Did it result in an injury or poisoning? (triedto_killyourself_lasttimeresult_abletoread)
12. Did it require medical attention? (triedto_killyourself_lasttimemedicalattention_abletoread)
13. Did it require overnight hospitalization? (triedto_killyourself_lasttimehospitalization_abletoread)

14. Looking at page 20 in your booklet, which of the three statements best describes your situation when Experience C happened to you (the last time) 1, 2, or 3? INTERVIEWER: EXPERIENCE C IS YOU TRIED TO KILL YOURSELF (triedto_killyourself_lasttimesituation_abletoread)

protocol.longName: Classification of Suicidal Ideation and Suicidal Behavior - Adolescent - Epidemiology
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Suicidality module of the World Mental Health Composite International Diagnostic Interview includes 14 interviewer-administered questions that address adolescent suicidal ideation, plans, attempts, intent, lethality, and method. The protocol includes parallel questions for those who can and cannot read.
